channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mrs. Shakespeare, Credit Hog
item.description: The literal-minded Hamnet abandons cultural outreach.

item.title: Trump says Rep. Crockett's Senate run 'a gift to Republicans': 'Can't imagine she wins'
item.description: President Donald Trump called Rep. Jasmine Crockett's Senate bid "a gift to Republicans," also criticizing her as a "low IQ person" and "terrible repr...

item.title: Democrat wins Miami mayor's race for the first time in nearly 30 years
item.description: Democrat Eileen Higgins won the Miami mayor's race on Tuesday, defeating a Republican endorsed by President Donald Trump to end her party's nearly thr...

item.title: Campaign Finance And The First Amendment Take Center Stage At SCOTUS
item.description: In NRSC v. FEC, the court will decide the constitutionality of restrictions on coordinated spending between candidates and political parties.

item.title: The Supreme Court Should Overturn Wong Kim Ark
item.description: The modern court has the chance to restore the 14th Amendment and end the judicially invented version of birthright citizenship.

item.title: Thomas Massie introduces bill to pull US out of NATO: ‘America should not be the world’s security blanket’
item.description: GOP Rep. Thomas Massie fielded a bill to remove the U.S. from NATO, putting forward a companion measure after Sen. Mike Lee introduced a bill earlier ...

item.title: Fed’s expected rate cut today is less about stimulating the economy and more about protecting the job market from ‘shattering’
item.description: A cut is something of an "insurance policy against a shattering of the U.S. labor market," UBS chief economist Paul Donovan said.

item.title: KISS and Company at the ‘All-American’ Kennedy Center Honors
item.description: If Trump’s goal is to create a Kennedy Center for the people, then this year’s Honors ceremony seemed entirely designed to vindicate their tastes.

item.title: 5 VCs sounds off on the AI question du jour
item.description: Who better to ask about a bubble than a group who will collectively deploy anywhere from tens to hundreds of millions of dollars over the next decade ...

item.title: Trump gives update on wounded National Guard member 2 weeks after DC ambush shooting: ‘He got up from bed’
item.description: National Guard Staff Sgt. Andrew Wolfe shows miraculous recovery after Washington, D.C., ambush shooting, moving from near-death to getting up from be...

item.title: Trump stumps for his economic success story to counter Democrats' 'affordability' narrative
item.description: President Trump returned to campaign mode to sell his economic agenda as the cure for Americans' frustration at the high cost of food and household go...

item.title: Inside tractor maker CNH’s push to bring more artificial intelligence to the farm
item.description: CNH CTO Jay Schroeder says using AI to improve farming is a decades-long passion. "I grew up on a family farm…so for me, it’s personal.”

item.title: The Effort to Tame Tech Is Bound to Fail
item.description: What Tristan Harris gets wrong.

item.title: Medicare Prescription Drugs Could Cost $500 Billion More Than Expected Over The Next Decade
item.description: A blog post by Congressional Budget Office staff dropped a bombshell: Spending on Medicare prescription drug coverage has exploded.

item.title: Exclusive: U.S. businesses are getting throttled by the drop in tourism from Canada: ‘I can count the number of Canadian visitors on one hand’
item.description: Canadians traditionally make up the largest group of international tourists to the U.S.

item.title: Zootopia 2 Teaches Kids They Have Trauma And It’s Their Parents’ Fault
item.description: Now Disney seems to be pushing the message that the happiest place on earth is as far away from your family as possible.

item.title: Activist investors are disproportionately targeting female CEOs—and it’s costing corporate America dearly
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Florida’s CAIR threatens lawsuit against DeSantis after he labels group a ‘foreign terrorist’ organization
item.description: CAIR Florida promised to sue after Gov. DeSantis labeled the Muslim civil rights group a "foreign terrorist organization" in an executive order.

item.title: Yes, Revive the Monroe Doctrine
item.description: We should, by all means, breathe new life into a doctrine that in recent decades has become a museum curiosity.

item.title: Florida Sues 3 Trans Groomer Groups For ‘Mutilating Kids And Misleading Families’
item.description: 'Defendants’ reprehensible and immoral actions capitalize on the mental distress of children,' the lawsuit states.

item.title: The ‘Restrainers’ Get Their Consolation Prize
item.description: The administration’s National Security Strategy document would not create a safer world for Americans.
